interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: The World of Sholom Aleichem
Review Date: 2013/10/16
Store: Zero Mostel  (Actor),     Nancy Walker  (Actor)    Rated:    Unrated    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, TV
Product Description: ["A compilation of three stories from Sholom Aleichem (known as the Yiddish Mark Twain) – “A Tale of Chelm,” about a bookseller who tries to buy a goat in a town of fools; “Bontche Schweig,” a tale of a poor man whose heavenly arrival coaxes tears from the angels; and “The High School,” about a couple's attempts to send their son to a non-religious school. Starring Zero Mostel, Nancy Walker and Sam Levene."]
Average Rating: 4.3
Product Details: {'Genre': 'TV', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, Full Screen, NTSC', 'Contributor': 'Jack Gilford, Nancy Walker, Zero Mostel, Sam Levene, Lee Grant', 'Language': 'English', 'Number Of Discs': '1', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1', 'MPAA rating': 'Unrated (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 0.7 x 5.4 inches; 2.72 Ounces', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, Full Screen, NTSC', 'Run time': '1 hour and 41 minutes', 'Release date': 'July 1, 2016', 'Actors': 'Zero Mostel, Nancy Walker, Sam Levene, Jack Gilford, Lee Grant', 'Studio': 'Entertainment One', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: I learned so much from this film about the origins of yiddish theater of which I'm a big fan. It described his work to a great extent.
Review Title: I really was facinated
Rating: 5.0

reference_summary:
5 Broken Cameras
Emad Burnat  (Actor, Director),     Guy Davidi  (Director)    Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Documentary
['Product Description', 'An extraordinary work of both cinematic and political activism, 5 Broken Cameras is a deeply personal, first-hand account of non-violent resistance in Bil\'in, a West Bank village threatened by encroaching Israeli settlements. Shot almost entirely by Palestinian farmer Emad Burnat, who bought his first camera in 2005 to record the birth of his youngest son, the footage was later turned into a galvanizing cinematic experience by co-directors Guy Davidi and Burnat. Structured around the violent destruction of a succession of Burnat\'s video cameras, the filmmakers\' collaboration follows one family\'s evolution over five years of village turmoil. Burnat watches from behind the lens as olive trees are bulldozed, protests intensify, and lives are lost. "I feel like the camera protects me," he says, "but it\'s an illusion".', 'Review', 'A rigorous and moving work of art. --A.O. Scott, The New York TimesUniquely powerful, putting faces and human consequences to a political dispute that will seemingly never end. --The Hollywood Reporter']
{'Genre': 'Special Interests', 'Format': 'Subtitled, Anamorphic, Multiple Formats, Dolby, Color, Surround Sound, Dubbed, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Guy Davidi, Emad Burnat', 'Language': 'Hebrew', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 30 minutes', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': '26172163', 'Director': 'Emad Burnat, Guy Davidi', 'Media Format': 'Subtitled, Anamorphic, Multiple Formats, Dolby, Color, Surround Sound, Dubbed, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 30 minutes', 'Release date': 'January 15, 2013', 'Actors': 'Emad Burnat', 'Dubbed': 'Arabic', 'Subtitles': 'English', 'Studio': 'Kino Lorber films', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'}
I think the issue of the Israeli occupation was a bit one sided from the biased point of view of the Palastinians. I suppose it could have gone both ways.
My opinion
A Yiddish World Remembered
Elliott Gould  (Actor),     Andrew Goldberg  (Director, Producer)    Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Documentary
['Elliott Gould narrates this Emmy Award winning documentary which revisits the beautiful Eastern European Jewish world before the horrifying aftermath of World War II. Using rare archival films, vintage photos, personal recollections, traditional cantorial and more, it becomes an emotional portrayal of Jewish traditions, religious treasures, the fascinating language of Yiddish and life as it was. 2002/color-b&w/100 min/NR/fullscreen.']
{'Genre': 'Special Interests', 'Format': 'NTSC', 'Contributor': 'Andrew Goldberg, Elliott Gould', 'Language': 'Unqualified', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 40 minutes', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.72 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'unknown', 'Director': 'Andrew Goldberg', 'Media Format': 'NTSC', 'Run time': '1 hour and 40 minutes', 'Release date': 'April 20, 2010', 'Actors': 'Elliott Gould', 'Producers': 'Andrew Goldberg', 'Studio': 'Shanchie Records', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'}
I enjoyed the film. It covers a lot of what I heard of the old country by my parents and grandparents
lots of good footage

profile:
**User Profile Summary:**

The user maintains a strong interest in documentary films that address political and social issues, particularly those that include personal narratives and storytelling. Their recent exploration of a film focusing on Jewish heritage and the impact of World War II underscores their appreciation for historical contexts and cultural narratives. 

The user is drawn to works featuring firsthand accounts and archival materials, reflecting a deep desire to understand complex human experiences and traditions. They are particularly engaged with cinema that promotes thoughtful activism regarding global conflicts, including sensitive subjects like the Israeli-Palestinian situation. 

Their latest interaction reveals a fascination with Yiddish theater and its origins, highlighting their appreciation for cultural arts and historical storytelling. The user values balanced portrayals in political narratives and maintains a critical lens regarding bias, showing a preference for works that challenge perceptions and spark introspection on contemporary issues. 

Overall, they seek thought-provoking content that combines emotional depth with cultural history, demonstrating a broad interest in narratives that resonate with personal and communal identities while navigating intricate societal themes. This consistent pattern highlights their analytical engagement with both historical and contemporary narratives, emphasizing a commitment to understanding diverse perspectives and artistic expressions.
